body: it seems that somehow streamlist needs to ensure that `'@deck.gl/mesh-layers'` is available

I think it would be as simple as adding in `mesh-layers` here (and need to import at top)

https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/fdcb1d0efdb53427c72bb266b08ef2d80b8a8cab/frontend/src/components/elements/DeckGlJsonChart/DeckGlJsonChart.tsx#L57

issue.title: ScenegraphLayer not available in streamlit by way of json / pydeck, "JSON converter: No registered class of type ScenegraphLayer"
issue.body:
#### Description
I'm attempting to use `ScenegraphLayer` in pydeck

#### Expected Behavior
I'd like to be able to reproduce this example

https://deck.gl/docs/api-reference/mesh-layers/scenegraph-layer

in pydeck within streamlit 

https://docs.streamlit.io/en/stable/api.html#streamlit.pydeck_chart

#### Repro Steps
```
    sample_model_layer = pydeck.Layer(
        "ScenegraphLayer",
        [
            {"name": "test",
             "coords" : [-83.7582848, 42.2739968],
            },
        ],
        "scenegraph-layer",
        get_position="coords",
        scenegraph='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/master/2.0/BoxAnimated/glTF-Binary/BoxAnimated.glb',
    )

    deck = pydeck.Deck(
        map_style="mapbox://styles/mapbox/light-v9",
        initial_view_state=pydeck.ViewState(
            latitude=42.2739968,
            longitude= -83.7582848,
            # latitude=np.median(gps_data.lat_lon.apply(lambda x: x[0])),
            # longitude=np.median(gps_data.lat_lon.apply(lambda x: x[1])),
            zoom=14,
            pitch=0,
        ),
        layers=[sample_model_layer],
    )
    streamlit.write(deck)
```
The rendered page, on the javascript side, ends up with 

"JSON converter: No registered class of type ScenegraphLayer"

I set a breakpoint and confirmed that at the logging point

https://github.com/visgl/deck.gl/blob/3d760068d788cf23487e8645a22ab6ecc029e26b/modules/json/src/helpers/instantiate-class.js#L14

`configuration.classes` does not include any of the mesh layers.

#### Environment
pydeck 0.7.0

#### Logs
<!-- Check the browser console for any relevant errors or warnings. -->

issue.title: Compatibility with streamlit

repository.name: earthengine-layers
repository.description: deck.gl layers for Google Earth Engine

issue.body:
I am trying to use earthengine-layers with [streamlit](https://streamlit.io/) for developing interactive web apps. The following code works fine in Jupyter notebook. When using the same code with streamlit, I got the error `JSON converter: No registered class of type`. Earth Engine layers do not show up on the map. Any advice?

```python
from pydeck_earthengine_layers import EarthEngineLayer
import pydeck as pdk
import ee

# Initialize Earth Engine library
try:
    ee.Initialize()
except Exception as e:
    ee.Authenticate()
    ee.Initialize()

# Create an Earth Engine object
image = ee.Image('CGIAR/SRTM90_V4')

# Define Earth Engine visualization parameters
vis_params = {
    "min": 0, 
    "max": 4000,
    'palette': ['006633', 'E5FFCC', '662A00', 'D8D8D8', 'F5F5F5']
}

# Create a pydeck EarthEngineLayer object, using the Earth Engine object and
# desired visualization parameters
ee_layer = EarthEngineLayer(image, vis_params)

# Define the initial viewport for the map
view_state = pdk.ViewState(latitude=37.7749295, longitude=-122.4194155, zoom=10, bearing=0, pitch=45)

# Create a Deck instance, and display in Jupyter
r = pdk.Deck(layers=[ee_layer], initial_view_state=view_state)
r
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5016453/137220221-aaff8a84-0577-42fc-9bee-9e48998f5355.png)

body:
Hi @krosaen!

I tried making [your suggested changes](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/3895#issuecomment-941055932) in my local dev env, and it seems to have gotten rid of the `JSON converter` warning as expected.

I am running into another error, though, and I've copied the stacktrace that appears in my browser console below.
```
Error: No valid loader found data: "", contentType: "application/octet-stream" url: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/master/2.0/BoxAnimated/glTF-Binary/BoxAnimated.glb
    at _callee$ (select-loader.js:13)
    at tryCatch (runtime.js:63)
    at Generator.invoke [as _invoke] (runtime.js:293)
    at Generator.next (runtime.js:118)
    at asyncGeneratorStep (asyncToGenerator.js:3)
    at _next (asyncToGenerator.js:25)
    at asyncToGenerator.js:32
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at asyncToGenerator.js:21
    at _selectLoader (select-loader.js:13)
    at selectLoader (select-loader.js:13)
    at _callee$ (parse.js:10)
    at tryCatch (runtime.js:63)
    at Generator.invoke [as _invoke] (runtime.js:293)
    at Generator.next (runtime.js:118)
    at asyncGeneratorStep (asyncToGenerator.js:3)
    at _next (asyncToGenerator.js:25)
```

I'm far from a pydeck expert, so I'd appreciate it if you happen to have an idea of what might be going on. Hopefully the additional work necessary to wrap up this change isn't too involved from here.

@giswqs, thanks for the suggestion! It may, unfortunately, be a bit more difficult to include custom pydeck layers since we would need to figure out a way to dynamically grab the required javascript and inject it into the streamlit frontend (I'm not totally familiar with how the earthengine layer works -- this is a best-guess as to what would be involved from what I've gleaned from the issue that you linked) . This would be a departure from the way most of our frontend dependencies work since, as far as I know, all of them are statically bundled when we create a streamlit wheel.

I would recommend opening a new issue for this feature request since it's likely to be significantly more involved than getting a core pydeck layer to work.

You might need to add the `@loaders.gl/gltf` dependency as well https://github.com/visgl/deck.gl/issues/4993#issuecomment-704053053.

However that is included as a dependency already of `@deck.gl/mesh-layers`, so not sure why it might not be being picked up. https://github.com/visgl/deck.gl/blob/9548f43cba2234a1f4877b6b17f6c88eb35b2e08/modules/mesh-layers/package.json#L35

What versions of the deck.gl packages are you using?

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit  A faster way to build and share data apps.

body:
@vdonato I have a pull request that fixes the issue for me when testing in development mode. 

Per @kylebarron 's comment, for me, I didn't need to add `@loaders.gl/gltf` because it is already a dependency for `@deck.gl/mesh-layers` - but I added it in any case to appease CI.

Thanks @karl-rosaen-skydio! I'll spend a bit of time testing the PR in my local dev env, but it more or less looks like what I was trying to do before I paused work on it due to being out on vacation for a week, so I expect the turnaround time to get the PR merged should be quite fast.
